description: Sugarman 23 Copy Elements - Single Source of Truth for the Universal Brand System

core_principle.axiom: Copy = Slippery Slide. Every sentence exists to get the next sentence read.
core_principle.mechanism: Sentence n gets sentence n+1. First sentence pulls reader in. Momentum builds. Reader slides down like child on playground slide. Cannot stop until bottom (purchase).

elements.name: Typeface
elements.application: Use the Sumi Breath type tokens. Prefer a highly legible humanist serif in print and a humanist sans on screens; verify readability for the medium.

elements.name: First Sentence
elements.application: Short, simple, compelling. Its only job is to get the second sentence read.

elements.name: Second Sentence
elements.application: Continue the pull. Build the slide's incline.

elements.name: Paragraph Headings
elements.application: Break text visually. Each heading should pull skimmers back into copy.

elements.name: Product Explanation
elements.application: Match complexity to product. Simple products = simple explanation. Complex products = patient education.

elements.name: New Features
elements.application: Highlight what's unique. Features become news when framed as innovation.

elements.name: Technical Explanation
elements.application: Include even if most won't read. Technical details = implied expertise.

elements.name: Anticipate Objections
elements.application: Raise objections before reader thinks them. Inoculation theory.

elements.name: Resolve Objections
elements.application: Answer every objection with evidence. Testimonials, data, guarantees.

elements.name: Gender
elements.application: Tailor language, examples, and concerns to audience demographics.

elements.name: Clarity
elements.application: No jargon. No clichÃ©s. Flesch score 60-70 (6th-8th grade level).

elements.name: Rhythm
elements.application: Vary sentence lengths. Long. Short. Medium. The music of prose.

elements.name: Service
elements.application: Address repairs, returns, support. Remove post-purchase anxiety.

elements.name: Physical Dimensions
elements.application: Always include specs. Size, weight, materials. Concrete beats abstract.

elements.name: Trial Period
elements.application: Longer trial = fewer returns. Counterintuitive but proven.

elements.name: Price Comparison
elements.application: Compare to expensive alternative. Anchor high, then reveal actual price.

elements.name: Testimonials
elements.application: Credible sources. Specific results. Photos increase trust.

elements.name: Price
elements.application: Large if low (value!), small if high (premium). Odd pricing ($97 vs $100).

elements.name: Offer Summary
elements.application: Clear statement of what they get for their money. Stack the value.

elements.name: Avoid Too Much
elements.application: Ruthless editing. Cut everything that doesn't serve the slide.

elements.name: Ease of Ordering
elements.application: Dotted coupon lines. Large buttons. Simple forms. Reduce cognitive load.

elements.name: Ask for Order
elements.application: Always close. Tell them exactly what to do. 'Order Now.'

elements.name: Graphic Elements
elements.application: 10 elements from headline through layout. Visual hierarchy serves the slide.

fifteen_axioms.axiom: First sentence = ad for second sentence
Sell the concept, not the product
Copy is never finished, only abandoned
Each element should reinforce the others
Selling cure is easier than prevention

usage_rules.reference_by: Use semantic ID (e.g., SUGAR_FIRST_SENTENCE) not number in all documents
usage_rules.audit_method: Run every piece of copy through all 23 elements as checklist
usage_rules.layer_priority: copy > offer > proof > conversion > visual (but all required)
usage_rules.slippery_slide_test: Read copy aloud. If you can stop anywhere naturally, the slide is broken.
